message: I wrote an article about lean startups @ http://jaredbrown.me/post/3806872575/lean-startups-rule and was interested in discussing lean startups with the community here. Do you use the lean startup model or are you big a proponent of it?
@jaredbrown a friend and I are two weeks into a four week development and launch plan for a lean startup... experimenting with it I guess.
and yes, we realize we will probably not meet the four week plan...
@hlfshell Do you have a URL or description you can share?

@jaredbrown we will also probably be organizing with our local hackerspace (both of us founders help founded a hackerspace locally) to do a 54 hour startup competition too, so who knows whats coming out of that. I think by nature everything there will have to be lean.
@operator why do you say startups can't be lean?
Startup must be lean, I think that's what @operator wants to say
It's surprising how many aren't lean though. I worked at one that wasn't.

i think its a misnomer. lean startup refers more towards incredibly rapid and heavy handed release schedule with mvps and being able to rapidly switch orientation to customers feedback. many startups are not lean.
Operator likely meant to say tautology
